This is the best game that I can't recommend. The shooting, the art, the sound—everything about it is the industry's best, held back by draconian progression systems and temporary-by-design story content. I imagine this game is comparable to something like heroin: it feels [i]so good[/i]... until it doesn't. And then you're stuck chasing the dragon. No other developer exhibits such frustrating inconsistency of quality and consideration for its players. The future of this live service game is uncertain, and that's a real shame because I'm pretty sure nothing will ever be as good as this game can be, could have been, should have been. | I... Just can't anymore.
When Bungie actually puts in effort into their game (Aka, major DLC's minus lightfall) the game is amazing, but the amount of times they have dropped the ball, especially with this last episode/season has finally done it for me. I've followed Destiny since the original on the xbox 360, became a fan of the story, and continued on into Destiny 2 back when they were still part of activision on battlenet. I've always attempted to keep good faith and put in a good word even when the game was at a low point, but now after having the saint-14 and osiris gay love story interjected and shoved down my throat multiple times, the last season "echos" big bad guy get one shot in a cutscene and escape by floating down a vex "milk" river, and now the current episode which started by reusing a game mode that they butchered and made worse than the original which was still in the game and the other gamemode that came later which was decent but had loot that you could get just by running around in the standard maps made it not at all worth doing. Compound that with the tonic system that relied on Strict RNG to get new tonics which were necessary to get further in the reputation system and played a minimal part in the over arching story and took forever just to get three tonics out of DOZENS WHICH BARELY WORKED AND WAS ON A TIMER THAT YOU HAD TO MICRO MANAGE ON TOP OF OTHER MICRO MANAGING SYSTEMS.... yeah it was just TOO MUCH.  The final nail in the coffin was the fact that we found out just how much work they put into the seasonal / episodic content which normally is spread out when they gave it all at one time. By the way you could do all 3 parts of revenant in less than 3 hours which for something that you pay for is absolutely Pathetic. For comparison Warframe Is completely 100% FREE and has proven to have a better player experience, impactful story, developers that actually care, better visuals, smaller file size, did not take paid content away forever (yes that happened in destiny), and more. 

I loved this game because it's story at one point was amazing and now... it's a chore.  Combine all that with the current state of the company's choices and behaviors, it's just not worth trying to keep the rose tinted glasses on and support it anymore.  I loved this game.... and I just feel betrayed and disappointed.  Call me a Schill, say I'm coping, or a hater I no longer care. Like many said Destiny was the only thing that could Kill Destiny, and well they did it.  I'm done supporting Bungie until they get their collective heads out of their ass.

Edit as to Toasty's comments, I don't care if Osiris and Saint are gay, I care that the fact that they are gay is more of a Slap to the face and is way too frequent as a main story beat, it's not subtle like other characters and kept in the background as an aspect of the character which would have made the first Episode much more impactful story wise. As Toasty mentioned Warframe has these notions and explores it but it's subtle and not in  your face and distracting from the overall story which is why I exemplify it's story over This one. Take that as you will but I stand with my choice and opinion, don't be assholes just because you disagree and have a different opinion.

For those who didn't fixate on being jerks trying to demonize another person,

Thank you.

For the rest of you pathetic losers who chose to HATE me because of your own personal LGBTQ AGENDAS over know that this review and opinion will never come down of my own volition but comments for this review will now be locked for YOUR HATRED towards me.

The lot of you should be Ashamed of yourselves. | 10 year veteran of the franchise. this new season brings to me the unfortunate realization its over. the game had the most amazing expansion in its history, just to turn around and fire loads of staff. bungie vets who made this series what it is (was practically) are gone, and you can feel it. new season with no exotic armor at all, mediocre activity that is just the same recycled event, with recycled modifiers from older content that is extremely tiring, just cus it worked once doesnt mean they need to do it 3 or so times. the sandbox is in a pretty great state, but the creativity of the team is dying out, and the lack of employees and budget is extremely obvious. Pete Parsons is directly responsible for cutting hundreds of devs and bringing this ship crashing into the ground. Destiny is genuinely unenjoyable and within the hour i was bored. this is genuinely depressing as i have thousands of hours, and thousands on psn and have loved the game through some of its lowest points. but the mediocrity of this season is killing me. i genuinely am worried this game will actually die for real within this act. | I think this is the best game ever made and it's not very close. I started playing around the time it went free to play and I'd do it again in a heartbeat. No other game does what this one does. I think everyone should get to experience what Destiny offers. This rating is positive because of what this game has meant to me, not because of what it has become.

[i]Currently:[/i]
[list]
	[*]This game is so unfairly priced that I can't genuinely recommend any of my non-Destiny friends or new players to pick it up to try it out.
	[*]The community is toxic as hell.
	[*]The game is dying, fewer and fewer people get on to play every single day.
	[*]There are cheaters in 1/3 of Crucible games (might just be caused by the dwindling player count making the concentration of cheaters higher).
	[*]Every new update is bugged (sometimes to the point of unplayability) and results in either server downtime, another update to address it (takes a month for this to get released), or Bungie just giving up and auto-completing quest steps.
	[*]The new player onboarding experience is abysmal. You're given a 5 minute cutscene to explain the story (since they completely removed the real campaign), a couple of introductory quests, and then you're kicked out of the bird's nest to do whatever your heart desires with minimal direction or suggestion on where to go. So bad, in fact, that Bungie has given up and now provides players with an option to skip it entirely since they know that if a new player is playing this game, it MUST be at the direction of another existing player telling them what to do anyway.
	[*]The game is riddled with power creep. Guardian kits are the strongest they have ever been and new aspirational content has gotten easier and easier.
[/list]

Realistically, the game needs a reset like Destiny 1 got with the release of Destiny 2, but Bungie's insistence on this being a forever game post-Final Shape has led to Destiny 3 being nothing but a pipe dream while this game wanes in its final days after the equivalent of an Avenger: Endgame story beat. Bungie just doesn't know when to let it go.

Some of my best memories are playing this game, but I just can't in good conscience say that you should start playing this game if you haven't already. You just had to be there, I guess. | 傻逼棒鸡越来越会圈钱了，年四刚出直接弃坑果然是我最聪明的一次，可惜那些没玩过年四之前的朋友们了，没去过１２１５，没见过满网都是土命２的视频，到处都是开坑教学，各种教学，生怕你不会玩，现在一问你玩什么，命运２，没听过小游戏吧，一手好牌打得稀烂，年四更新一百多G删到九十G，以前死命肝的枪年四买季票直接领东西换，删称号，删地图，删成就，现在补回来了又怎么样呢，有不少人都记得有个傻逼鸡一手好牌打稀烂，可惜年四刚玩年五刚玩的新玩家都不知道这事情，那我亲爱的朋友，现在你知道了吗，知道为什么感觉现在这么好个游戏不温不火了吗。

This game was very cute and fun, a fantastic game to unwind and relax! Nevertheless, the combat was genuinely fun and engaging, like a game of chess. Additionally, the voices and script are pretty dang good, much better and more solidly characterized than I expected. Currently playing through the game on high difficultly, and there are some genuinely stressful rounds that make you think about strategy and who to sacrifice where. The game itself has potential but where it falls down is how outdated the game design feels and the AI control over your units. It harkens back to an era of micromanagement of unit abilities which we really should have moved beyond. I don't find it personally enjoyable to have to babysit my infantry units telling them when to use their grenades or other such basic combat abilities. Realistically that sort of micromanagement should be toggleable or in cases where it's not limited by resource but is time delayed by cooldowns should be automatic. 

I've also come across serious AI issues in which sometimes I would tell three rifle units to attack move and on seeing the enemy well within range they will continue to move rather than stop and fight. In those cases I mention their firing lanes were not blocked. On other occasions where their firing lanes were blocked they did indeed stop and contributed nothing to the fight. This has led to me losing pushes when I was counting on that to function properly in taking an area I knew they only had warriors while I focused on retaking a bigger fight. The end result being the fight which should have been a clear victory instead resulted in my troops being annihilated because I could not micro manage two fights simultaneously.

If these two key things are improved - AI and the abilities - I can see this being much enjoyable and a recommend for those interested in this sort of game. | Thoroughly enjoyed the main campaign, sadly lacking replay value. Glad the devs have committed to adding a mode specifically designed for replay. | Man, the ai in this game is dumb as a box of rocks. You cannot leave them alone for a single nano-second. The fact that you cannot fire and move with 90% of the units means you have to stagger your assaults. One unit moves up to cover the next unit moving up and so on, if you try giving orders to your whole army youll just end up having them slowly walk forward into the arms of the bugs while not firing. I like the concept of staggering your approaches more than I like it in execution because you will inevitably run into a situation where youre moving up some of your units while one or more cover the rear only to realize that in the 3 seconds it took to move up said units, a tanker bug came around a corner and instantly killed a full rifle squad, and your recruitment base is on the other side of the map so youre SOL. I know it's sacrilegious to say but this game really would benefit from a pause or slow time feature. "But then it wouldnt be an RTS" Shut up they have it in Terminator: Dark Fate and that game slaps.

Idk I wish steam had a "Meh" review option because I do really like this game, its thematic and really does a good job of capturing the essence of Starship Troopers. The levels are engaging, the enemy variety is good, and when it works, it WORKS you feel great after accomplishing a task because the entire time its an uphill battle. I suppose if I could summarize my experience with the game in one word I would use "Frustrating". | If you enjoy the franchise than you will love this game...The only negative I have is I wish it had a skirmish mode or conquest mode | One of the worst RTS games I think I've ever had the displeasure of playing. The balance is bad and the AI is just downright stupid. Your soldiers will just walk into bugs half the time with attack move if you don't babysit them.

Enshrouded, as an Early Access title, does some things well and some not so well, but it is all subject to change. We'll see how things go over the next few years. Overall, it's fun enough, and the developers have been very forthcoming with game additions and are also very open and responsive to player feedback. This game does Early Access right.

Pros:
-Gorgeous visuals
-Gorgeous world, procedurally-generated and then lovingly populated with hand-crafted locations
-Incredible, detailed and interesting dungeons to delve through, filled with puzzles and environment hazards
-Beautiful, if inconsistent, armor and weapon designs, which are fun to collect.
-A fairly robust building system, with benefits to decorating and constructing a base that you then populate with craftspeople and villagers
-Simple, but satisfying combat
-A leveling system that revolves around perks instead of stat increases (though you can still boost your stats from the perk tree)
-Dedicated cosmetic slots for your armor, with options to hide both your headgear and your gloves
-Fully cosmetic clothing sets to find behind exploration and bosses
-A food-based buff system, wherein the food you eat increases your stats and stat regeneration
-Lots of lore to discover through characters, locales, obelisks and books throughout the world
-Highly customizable game settings, including the ability to turn off weapon and tool durability or turn on starvation mechanics

Cons:
-The bonuses from armor and weapons are largely pointless, or too small to make much of a difference. Some are even entirely pointless, such as one set that offers a small 10-20% bonus to unarmed damage, with unarmed attacks dealing only 8 damage to enemies (when your mace is doing over 400 per swing, and swings faster than your fists)
-There are tons of weapons, but there are very little differences between weapons of the same class: All one-handed weapons use the same three-swing combo, regardless of what the weapon actually is, and even legendary items don't have anything to differentiate them outside of their raw damage and visuals
-The few weapons with "unique" effects are things like 5% lifesteal, 1 point of health regen, or some bonus critical chance and damage. None of the weapons are build-defining or unique in any meaningful way. For example, the "Dragon Sword", found only one hidden place and tied to a piece of esoteric lore found in your travels, just adds a flat +7 fire damage... Five times in a row. The Dragon Sword is a weapon with nothing going for it except minuscule damage bonuses that don't even interact with your perks.
-Extremely linear item and location progression: New areas are blocked off by "Deadly Shroud," a gas that simply kills you if you haven't leveled up your base enough yet (using the heads of bosses and regional materials). Essentially, your ability to explore the "open world" aspect of the game is heavily restricted by boss progression.
-Heavily reused enemies with very limited attack variety
-The magic system is bland, being exclusively ranged elemental attacks and two healing spells. There is no utility magic to speak of, outside of a single knockback spell
-The perks you gain from leveling are very restrictive in what they affect, very strictly confining their offerings to their respective stat tree (Strength, Intelligence, Dexterity) with very little overlap
-Every quest is a fetch or kill quest with some lore sprinkled around it. "Skyrim quest" is how I would describe them: Talk to a person, go to a place, get a thing, repeat until you run out of quests | I have played for about 800 hrs. The story is interesting, and the game is definitely playable solo. I completed the game, through level 35 as a solo player with out much problem. Some things take longer (i.e. Hollow Halls), but nothing is impossible to complete. The group play is pretty good too, though there are currently performance issue, though not surprising since this in in EA. There is also no in-game chat (text or voice), but I found a group of people, and we were able to overcome it using Discord. Used basic building blocks in-game to write out Discord info.

I absolutely love the building system. Though it could use work with camera control and additional options (round shapes), the building potential is endless. Of my almost 800 hrs of play, at least 600 has been spent building.

I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes survival/building games! | Started playing this on steam deck non oled version and it plays and runs great straight out of the box. This should be verified and not unsupported | 結論からいうと面白い

ジャンルはオープンワールドサバイバルクラフト。
資源を集めて道具を作って敵を倒してエリア開拓してというあれである。
ARKや7 Days to Die、Valheimなどの名作を経てこの霧の王国に移住したが、これはこれできちんと楽しませてくれた。

剣があり弓があり魔法がありパリイありと、アクション面はオーソドックス。
特徴としては前述のゲームらと違い、かなり進行の導線が強め。行ける場所が進行度によって明確に区切られ、またストーリーにおいても順序がきちんと立てられている。

建築はだいぶストレスフリー。プレイヤーが設置した祭壇を中心とした特定範囲内のみ建築可能というシステムで、その範囲内ならば重力などを気にせず自由に設置できる。空中に農園を置くことだって可能。効率を取るか、デザインを取るか、プレイヤーは悩むことになるだろう。

横道となるサブクエストも豊富で、NPCが豊富にいるのも特徴か。この手のゲームをやっていて、立派な基地を作っても俺しかいないしなあ…と寂しさを感じたプレイヤーは少なくないと思うが、それだけに基地をNPCがうろついてるのはなんとなく嬉しい。

自由な進行こそ制限されているものの、全体的なプレイ感として、建築要素のあるSkyrimといった感じが近いと思う。シャウトはないけど。

ネックとしては早期アクセスゲームであり、バグがまあまああるところ。こればかりは今後の改善を期待するしかないが、一応個人の体験として進行不能になるほど重篤なバグには遭遇しなかった。

全体の総括として「現時点で十分面白いし、更に今後のアプデが期待出来るのは嬉しい」といったところ。サバイバルクラフトゲーの移住先を考えてる人、おすすめです。

This game doesn't feel right. 
Judging by the trailers and genre it self-identifies as a horde survival game, with the implication you'll endlessly be struggling against a swarming blob that pushes against your walls and defences.
Unfortunately, it's more like a mad rush for min-maxxing resources before a wave spawns and marches at you. In the earlier levels, this means the wave is extremely small and underwhelming. 90% of the time you are not in combat and are being secretly fought against by the clock of economy efficency.
The game doesn't seem to know what it wants to identify as. Some units want you to micromanage abilities and boosts like a Total War game, but in other ways it feels like it wants you to fire and forget troops into big blobs that fight the enemy. The pathfinding makes combat pretty nasty, too. The enemies walk in a straight line towards something, not flank or try to outsmart defences etc. So in terms of tower defence it is also pretty bland. In fact one of the metas is to actually entirely ignore the tower-building aspect of the game and just build a huge mass of infantry blobs to swamp and enemy unit that gets close to you.

The difficulty is also obscene. The game is challenging on even the baby difficulty and ruins the potential the game would have for a chill version where you simply treat the game like a city builder.

The game isn 't awful, but it doesn't really have any holding power. Big fights are done better elsewhere, city building is done better elsewhere, RTS style resource mad-dashes are done better elsewhere. The artstyle is pretty decent but the story/cutscenes drag pretty badly. I'm not sure this game can defend its existence against They Are Billions or even genre-adjacent games like Total War, Ultimate Epic Battle Simulator, or city builders like Manor Lords. | ---{ Graphics }---

目前体验约等于简陋版本的帝国时代，但是帝国时代好歹也能探地图，而且树林不可穿越从而延申出前期的建筑学，总之就是细节较少且对玩法限制较大，整体而言与塔防关系不大，里面的塔甚至要驻兵才能攻击。

Reviews:
Arguably one of the greatest MMOs to have ever been made. To date, no competitor has been able to match the agency given to the player in main story decisions and side quest narratives. Each class or (combat style) has a unique identity to it that makes them so much more than a binary "You have a lightsaber" or "You have a blaster." Combat is not super complex yet each combat style has a healthy sized kit of buttons at your disposal for both rotational combat and niche utility. Through your character origin story and beyond the game doesn't railroad you into being a voiceless hero who can only accept orders and go be the good guy akin to FFXIV or WoW. Your character has a say in the overall narrative whether that be benevolent or evil intentions. I genuinely believe more people would be playing this game if it weren't for the fact that it was based in the star wars universe and that alone filters a ton of potential players. | The majority of the class story missions are very well written, and have the potential to be very, VERY funny if you pick the right dialogue option.  The combat feels great, and the companions are (mostly, looking at you Kaliyo) likeable.  Their subscription model is something I can really appreciate; subscribe, and every single piece of paid content is there for you to enjoy, even if your sub runs out.

I don't have much experience with other MMOs, like FFXIV, WoW, etc., so I can't speak on how the game feels to play when compare to them, but I have thoroughly enjoyed my 1000+ hours spent on this game, as well as my irresponsible amount of cartel coins I've purchased over the last 2 years.

Great game, 100% would recommend. | If you love Star Wars, this is your game to play!

It's not as hard as the other XCOMs, but that doesn't mean it's easy. | bleh. This game is like "We have XCOM 2 at home" walmart off-brand version. Just a massive letdown compared to both it's predecessors. I know people say that this game isn't a true successor to XCOM 2 and that's it's apples to oranges, but these apples are spoiled with worms in them. I can't recommend it | As a long time X-Com fan I felt offended by this product. I can’t call it a game. A game, by definition is an activity that one engages in for amusement or fun, This  is not engaging, arguably fun. This is a product created, packed and sold with the minimum effort just to pursue a specific agenda and, unfortunately, has the name of a very cool franchise on it.
The ONLY “ok” aspect of this product is the gameplay. Breaching games are extremely rare and the idea of having an alien and human swat team doing police business it was interesting and it was the biggest appeal for me. Small maps, quick actions, repetitive gameplay loop but with different variations? Why not. Troubleshooter is one of my favorite game and it doesn’t even have a breach mode.
Too bad the rest of the product is awful. It’s not “bad”, it’s “awful”. If you want a TLDR and you get the reference, this product can be called “X-Com Velma (2023 HBO)”.
You no longer have a squad of nobodies who are trying their best to save the world, you have a pre-selected team of aliens and humans which are only walking tropes, generally uninteresting, assholes or constantly judging hypocrites. Or any combination of the former. The “characters” interactions are just Marvel quipping (in missions and during rest time) and they have no in-between moral position. They are “I am so tolerant look at me” “I was on your side all the time” “I didn’t deserve this” or “I am a dumb racist”. You can say I’ve played two hours so I can’t really judge an eventual “character development”. No wait I have internet, I can because I’ve read everything about this product so yeah I can judge.
They made me hate a snake lady. I will never forgive them for this.
Also those awful portraits and general art style. Just why. And why they changed the mutton this much? This is X-Com not Lilo and Stich.
But that’s not even the worst point. No, the worst point is the only moral of the product: RACISM BAD. Now don’t put out the pitchforks yet. There is a teeny bitsy little thing to add.
RACISM (against the aliens that enslaved humanity, killed literally millions, put people in concentration camps and use them as food or slave labor or genetic experiments and had a unit 731 in every human city) BAD.
I want also to point out only FIVE years have been passed since X-Com 2 events. You remember how American people were so tolerant and friendly with Japanese after WW2? Or the polish with the Germans? Or the Chinese with the Japanese? Everybody knows we humans are a wonderful and tolerant race.
The product has the moral high ground to judge ANYONE who is against the established order RACIST BAD. There is no compromise, they are RACIST so you have to kill them on sight.
The bad guys are so comically evil, kids Sunday morning cartoons evil. They have no layers, they are bad, they do bad things you MUST hate them. You want more info? No, they are evil, they do bad things.
This is also a detriment for the gameplay. In SWAT games, literally and the genre, you are usually punished to shoot without warning or for cheap violence. You are there to arrest and defuse potential harm to civilians. That’s not the case, fuck them racist, kill ‘em all. 
In X-Com you have to kill on sight because there is a WAR on the background. Here you are in peace times. This product literally endorse police violence and brutality just because “they are racists man, they deserve it”. Oh but they are really smart pointing out “you are not the police”. You are acting like police, you are addressed as a police force, you are arresting and killing people in critical felony or criminal situations but nono, you are not the police.
Yes I know the aliens in X-Com are basically other alien races enslaved against their will. I know. But the product shouts in my hear 24\7 JUST ACCEPT IT. People MUST ACCEPT aliens in position of power, all over the media, basically having more power than humans. People MUST BE FRIENDLY WITH THEM OR BE KILLED OR ARRESTED. You really want me to believe in a democratic election an ALIEN won the major race. We have ALIEN social media “influencers”, cops are aliens, aliens in position of power. After all that happened? And everyone against this is “bad” by definition.
This is not even suspension of disbelief, this is insane agenda pushing. And we are not even talking about a world war, economic, political crisis. Railgrade is a difficult game to classify.  It's definitely not a train sim, as it isn't deep or detailed enough.  It's more like a simple logic-gate puzzle game under pressure, with an entertaining train wrapper, a fantastic synthwave soundtrack, and a good sense of humor.  

It is absolutely a fun train-set-building game.  Even if it weren't a compelling puzzler and a good strategy game, it would be great fun in that regard.

I can see why the devs call it an RTS -- it is one -- but the absence of combat is going to make most potential players disagree (which is ridiculous).

To put my sense of Railgrade in RTS-fan terms, it's an actions-per-minute trainer.  

- "Produce X marines in Y minutes."  
- "Reach a production rate of X zerglings *per* minute."  
- "Deliver X zealots, W dragoons, and Z templar through the map's chokepoints to the designated location in Y minutes."

There's no conflict that threatens to end your run.  The only enemies are the timer, the budget, and the limits of your logical thinking.  I wish this were more common in the RTS genre, where training advice and tools generally consist solely of an ineffective solo campaign and some rando online suggesting that you "get good."

The timer is a harsh mistress.  Getting top rank is no joke.  You'll need an intimate understanding of the way the game functions and how to manipulate it to perform efficiently at the speeds required.  Some missions start you with plenty of budget for setup, but others leave little room for error.  

I have to admit that it is still something of a mystery to me how one sets up an effective economy to support the required production within the allotted time, in many of the more tightly tuned missions.  I usually play with the timer off -- one of multiple options available to customize gameplay to the player's preference.

Railgrade can, on occasion, be brutally unforgiving -- it is very easy in many missions to overextend yourself or make a switching error that bottoms out your budget with shocking speed.  Usually this is recoverable -- slowly -- but sometimes it can mean the loss of hours of planning and design effort.  

Loans are an out-and-out trap for all but the swiftest clickers -- as befits the '80s arch-capitalist hellscape of the setting, the bank will automatically debit you the interest on your loan every minute, but leave the capital untouched.  Bank deposits can be a good, if expensive, route to sustainability, but even these are fundamentally unfair, paying flat dividends rather than increasing interest.

The game does have the capability to save a checkpoint, but you really need to be on the ball to know when that is timely.  Otherwise, you only get one save slot per mission, so your options are restart or suffer through. | まだまだ全然途中だが、気になるところがそこそこあったので忘れないうちにレビュー。

ゲームの概要としては、資源の上に採取施設を作り、加工施設や販売施設等に輸送するために施設間に線路を敷き、荷下ろしのために駅を作り、電車を編成して走らせて輸送させる、というのの効率を改善してステージごとの目標を達成していく感じ。ステージは結構な数があるので、自分のようにサンドボックスだと目的を見失うタイプの人間にはかなりおすすめ。とはいえ、難易度がかなりバラバラに並んでいる感はあるので、スコアにこだわる人はイライラするかも知れない。気にせず先に進めて色々アンロックしてから戻ってくるのが良いと思う。

気になった点としては、線路を敷くのが基本のゲームなのに、まっすぐ敷くのが難しいこと。高低差を考慮した最適ルートに勝手に調整されてしまうので、かなりぐちゃぐちゃな線路になって扱いにくい。しかも敷きなおしにはコストがかかるのでややストレス。ステージ開始前は時間が止まっていて自由に敷きなおし可能なのだが、それに近い感じで仮置きモードみたいなのがあるといいかなとは思った。

また、駅と施設の関連付けが距離でしかできないので、駅を大きくした結果別の施設が反応するようになってしまって効率が悪くなるなどの事故が起きやすいのも減点ポイント。この施設はスルーするみたいな設定ができるようになって欲しいと思う。

遊んでいて致命的にしんどいと思ったのは、時間経過で夜になって画面が凄く見づらくなることだが、これについては設定のアクセシビリティの中に日中モードという項目があるので、これを有効にすると夜にならなくて良い。

正直な感想としては、時間経過でスコアが変わるのは許容できるにしても、時間停止も倍速モード等もない状態では手際よくやらないといけないことに対するストレスが大きすぎるので、かなり人を選ぶ感じにはなってしまっているかなと。この点もゲーム性を損なわない範囲でどうにか時間コントロールできるようにしてほしいところ。

次のステージの開放演出が毎回入ってイラっとするとか、スコア微妙なステージをリプレイしようと思ったら前のクリア状態から再開されるのでリセットしないといけなくてイラっとするとか、改善の余地はたくさんあるがこの手のゲームにしてはかなり起動がスムーズなのは好印象。 | very fun and easy to learn,, in no time u realize youve been playing for 5 hours | Great game. As others have said it reminds me of Transport Tycoon. The levels slowly build your understanding and with 50 odd there is lots to learn. I am enjoying going back and improving my score so I say its wonderful value. I am hoping for more updates and levels though? | Really enjoying playing this. The campaign/story mode is massive! tl;dr: This is a very tentative "yes" made under the assumption that the bugs get fixed and with the recommendation of only getting it on a very deep discount like it is right now. It's not a bad game by any stretch but it costs almost as much as They Are Billions while only having a fraction of the content. Maybe for some people the multiplayer makes up for the lack of content, for me it really doesn't. 

The campaign while ok is very short and in a lot of places it feels like it's rushing you due to the time limits and not letting you explore at your leisure. I don't know why some are complaining about difficulty since most missions have a "gimmick" and are pretty easy to turtle in and then methodically wipe out the enemies, especially since the AI always seems to send the same attack force at you and doesn't really scale up as the mission goes on. Most of the maps are interesting but again in plenty of missions you just feel rushed and don't really get to "sit and enjoy the view" so to speak, in some you don't even really get to defeat the enemies either since they're completely optional. It's interesting that they sometimes give you choices on what path you can take but it doesn't really change anything about the final result or the story. The final boss is interesting but easily cheesed. 

Survival mode is the "meat" of the game, just like with TAB, but while you have new gameplay elements like Warcraft 3 style heroes, hero gear and elites to deal with it just doesn't feel like it makes up for the low choice in terms of towers and units. It feels like they could have done so much more in terms of both since it's a fantasy setting but the content and replay value just aren't there, at least for me. 

Bugs galore. The pathing in particular is still very bad, even after years of allegedly attempting to fix the issues, you will see your soldiers just splitting in very weird ways when given orders to engage the enemy, getting stuck in place because they can't decide who to go for or even rushing in a weird direction because they couldn't all path properly to the target or location you ordered them to. This was probably the source of most of my frustration with the game in the time i played it and it's definitely something you don't want to see in an RTS. Pathing still seems just as bad on the 1.0 version. I'm also noticing on the 1.0 a lot of times where the enemy melee creatures get stuck trying to move through your frontline to get to the archers essentially walking in place while they get stabbed to death because they're fixated on your archers.

I've also had some weird issues with hero abilities not triggering correctly/not doing "what it says on the tin" and control groups breaking. Also on the 1.0 the enemy AoE markers seem to not match the actual size of the ability with the abilities sometimes hitting your units even though they're way out of the marker. I have no interest in the multiplayer so i won't give it a separate section but that also seems to be very buggy for many players and they didn't even bother having a propery lobby system, expecting people to go to their discord to find other players to match with which is a very weird decision.

My final gripe is with the Alderin faction, it feels like it's only being cut to be added later as DLC despite the fact that it seems to more or less already have the prerequisites for a full faction. The excuse i've seen give was that the hero selection screens and one extra skin for the main building are very expensive to make and they don't have the extra funds for it. I'd like to focus on the part about the hero selection as i don't even understand why those animated selection screens are even a thing to begin with. This isn't a hero shooter or a moba, it's literally an element that adds nothing to the game and you only see it for a few seconds when selecting your character. Why invest so many resources in a flashy feature that has zero effect on actual gameplay? Why not give us an extra faction on the 1.0 instead? | I really REALLY want to like this game. It's 90% fun. There has been a bug since 2 years ago. You reach a point in like the 3rd night, control groups stop working. Like at all. You make a command with group 1, you make a different command with group 2, and group 1 tries to do group 2's command, and often times, group 2 will just freeze in place. Not even on normal stop, or hold position, like the unit freezes and won't attack. I can't play 2 fronts, let alone 3-4 fronts not because of a "skill issue" but because the controls are so bad it is in an unplayable state. I'm sorry, whats the point of multiple control groups, army's front ect if the commands LITERALLY do not work. So Fing sick of having two separate armies, one holding a north choke one holding, say, the east choke, telling army 1 to pull back behind the wall, and watching army two just leave their post to go hand out with army 1, even though I just told army two to attack. Trying to protect your buildings, Impossible. Your units are just randomly chasing the last order given. At first you may think, wow I suck, but like the third game when you have army hotkey 3 randomly decide to explore a random pathway YOLO suicide style and you think, wow I must suck at this game, only to realize 20 hours later it's "No, you don't suck, that army 3 you let to defend just decided they were part of army 1. They were just "following orders" Well how in the hell did they get those orders!?! Broken game.
 1.0 releases tomorrow. If this bug is still there, my review will not change. Do not waste your money, you will be pissed when you spend 2-3 hours in a run to watch it all fall apart and be flying in a game with multiple points held, only to be unable to play, because 3 of your armies refuse to follow there commands and the unit commands are just shit.

Pardon the rant. I want to like this game. But If I can not play it because the armies are not following the commands I give not because of a skill issue, or a user error mistake (I'm not perfect) but coming from a serious game breaking bug, I have to tell people to STAY AWAY.

It losses all fun when your units aren't following commands and you're trying to hold 3 fronts.

Edit: Still not fixed. I also did not wait until now to mention this bug. I've reported it twice over the last two years eagerly awaiting for it to be fixed as the game moves out of early access, and one of the reasons I'm as  salty as I am over it. To the Dev, still hoping this get fixed, will update review when/if it is fixed.

Edit: Tried campaign, also has numerous (frustrating, not game breaking) bugs, units going through the ground and losing vision trying to expand, target strongest/closest not working, ect. Game had a ton of potential. | Game design has much potential and IMO superior to they are billions, but whoever did the technical side and Unit AI/pathing should never find work again. Your units will literally attack a stationary section of wall while being hit in melee by other units. Unit pathing was better in 90s games such as SC1 and C&C1 (and they had flaws). And every time the game loads, I wonder if my computer will crash. | 感觉还是挺好玩的，不过希望可以加入类似风暴之城或者马上出的文明7里面的那种打完一局可以获得点数局外升级的系统，这样除了每一局内的成长，局外也有成长，感觉会更促进我肝这个游戏~~！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！ | 好玩的

What began as a game bursting with potential quickly devolved following a DLC that not only failed to live up to expectations but also seemed to overlook the core elements that made the game special in the first place. Despite being priced as high as the original game, the DLC offered little value, leaving much to be desired.

Moreover, the game has been plagued by technical issues, from random game crashes to matchmaking disconnects. Although community members have stepped up to provide fixes and workarounds, these problems should have been addressed by the developer long ago. It's also troubling to hear reports that game testers were not compensated for their contributions, reflecting poorly on the developer’s business practices.

The attempts to rejuvenate the game after significant time has passed feel disingenuous, especially to a community that has dwindled significantly. This developer was once a favorite of mine, known for their innovative ideas and quality content. It's a real shame to see such a decline in quality and commitment.

Given the current state of affairs, I find it difficult to recommend this game or its additional content at full price. If the entire game, including the DLC, ever drops below $15, it might be worth considering for the storyline alone, but be aware that the community is largely inactive. This is just a warning for those thinking about investing their time and money. As for myself, this experience has made me cautious about future purchases from this developer. | The game was flawed on release. The endgame loop was missing a more direct path too gear completion. When the World slayer dlc was added the game felt more complete. The campaign was great, but you need the dlc for the game. I'm would like for them to make more content for the game or make a second Outriders. This game has the potential to be greater then Destiny Back when it was good. | 7.5/10 game.
- Solid story and worldbuilding - much better than what I was expecting from a looter-shooter.
- Good combat - can either be tactical or frantic depending on your build and on particular encounter.
- Satisfying difficulty and gear progression.
- Good amount of build variety and freedom for experimentation (on demand respec, crafting gear for specific build comes rather easy).

Minor/vague critique:
- I've played only solo and don't know if/how much fun coop is.
- Little verticality to arenas, no jumping and in general your movement is supposed to be more on a tactical side. If you look for high mobility gameplay this isn't it.
- Story is good but on the rails so you can't affect protag decisions.
- Couple main story bits and events are very deus ex machina and cutscenes feel a bit disjoint from what you see happening in game moments before.
- Although I praise writing I do so as a person reading every single note found in the game. I imagine if you'd not get into any of that world and story would feel more shallow.
- The story delivered through voiced dialogues and cut-scenes is rather on effficient side - you won't be indulged by extensive dialogues with companions about their life and game world - for that you mainly have mentioned notes (which are well written).
- I think there are couple weird technical issues - game did crash on me few times over 40h and once refused to launch supposedly due to no server connection (PC restart helped).

This game has an original take on factory games, but sadly it is unplayable as it has serious game-breaking bugs that still haven't been fixed. Namely that runners just never deliver certain things randomly. I have a full storage with crystals and it's on the network, but they just won't deliver to certain things randomly. I thought maybe not enough runners so I made 20 more runners. Many are sitting around idle and they just won't deliver the full crystal to other things on the network.

Sometimes this stuck state can be cleared by right clicking to clear the production and then just setting it to craft the same thing again. This is how I know it's 100% a bug, but the dev is in denial and tries to explain it away as you not knowing how to play the game. The game couldn't POSSIBLY have any bugs!

Units also just stop collecting resources when they run out of space, but they don't start up again when there is space free. Please stop adding things and just make the basic game playable already. | I like the concept of the game. The early game is great, but it gets really difficult to scale. There are behaviors that can be programmed into the bots, but you have to go to YouTube to figure out how anything actually works. I would have much preferred a programming scheme like Autonauts, where it's very clearly defined what your bots are doing in the world, and if a bot is stuck, you can see immediately where it is on the logic chain.

I really like to dig into production chains, but I spent more time micromanaging my resource collectors than anything else. Fewer resource nodes with higher resource counts for default settings would help immensely with this. It's also frustrating to know that there are hidden recipes for converting items and bots, but no information in-game on how to gather them. The research tree has nodes requiring resources that you haven't unlocked yet, but won't tell you what they are.

Overall, I think the biggest problem with this game for me is that I expected a production game with a side of exploration, but it really feels like an exploration game with a side of production. | The control and logistic scheme is annoying and bot 'programming' is done with spaghetti nodes. 

Making buildings is tedious and there is no apparent way to automatically manufacture depending on demand that I have found. The logistics network generally does a poor job, and the UI makes the game appear far more complicated than it actually is, Doing literally anything is a PITA. 

This is supposed to be a factory / programming game I think but struggling to find those elements in the swamp of obtuse design. | A great game that blends RTS and Logistics Games... but needs WAY better tutorials

Other reviews say you need behaviors to solve everything, but that isn't the case. Usually, the right combination of components and setting the right stuff in the unit UI will get most things done... Or structuring the units correctly. However, if you are not interested in making behaviors this game may not be for you.

The tutorial also fails to mention you can save "prefabs/blueprints" to a personal Library so that way you can automate making custom units. If the idea of customizing your units in a meaningful way to solve problems sounds fun, this game is for you.

Expect to invest 2-4 hours of learning to get into the depth of the game, using both in-game tutorials and out-of-game tutorials. | "beltless factorio"

天天就抱着你那垃圾PVP瞎几把更新，跟英雄连2有一拼。你真以为这烂PVP有很多人玩？
你6.0更新的啥玩意？减溅射数量，搞得很多怪步、怪骑和巨兽的多段连击无法生效（连击动作会平分溅射数量，并向下取整，导致部分连击动作的攻击目标为0，完全没有伤害。比如基斯里夫熊骑兵，有个熊左右拍掌+下砸的三连攻击动画，但是熊骑兵更新后的溅射数量只有1，导致这个三连击动作的平均攻击目标都为0，食人魔噬人者也因为溅射数量少打不过一些低级矛兵），很多反步的怪兽在6.0更新后连帝国长戟都打不过。

然后最近的更新了修复溅射问题，结果只修复了多模组的怪步和怪骑，巨兽没修，导致震旦的陶俑直接大废物一个，因为陶俑的大风车有十几次连击，这个长动作在目前版本直接0伤害，问就是溅射模组不够分，震旦人不配玩这个游戏是吧。

这次更新最严重的问题是暴露了现在ca的设计师都是新人，而且不理解游戏以前的设计思路，就怕ca内部是上演了育碧那套新来的LGBT贵物排挤赶走老员工的套路，再加上ca现在一直死盯着pvp不放，这游戏在这么下去真没啥指望了。。。 | The best fantasy war strategy game around, only gripe is the cost of all three games and some factions being DLC but even with just the base content you have a ton of content here. | This game gets a lot of hate - some of it justified, especially on the corporate financial side of things. However, what it does well it does really well like no other:

After a long day's march, your dwarves begin digging into the top of a hillside overlooking a long valley below. Your scouts have determined a large horde of skaven are sulking in the shadows somewhere nearby. You do not know yet if they will give battle in the morning or will instead cowardly skulk off during the night, but it's best to be prepared for a fight regardless.

Your left flank is densely wooded and covered by a few detachments of veteran Longbeards and Rangers. Their lines have to be uncomfortably thinned out to cover the broad front before them but the terrain should make a big attack unlikely. Not to mention rats are notoriously too hasty and uncoordinated to make good such a venture. Visibility is poor however so who knows what will be unveiled in the underbrush when the morning fog lifts.

You are strongest in the center flank, among the ragged ruins of an ancient castle near the top of the hill where you have made your encampment for the night.  The approach is difficult with many cliffs and boulders funneling any would-be attackers into a few narrow channels. Your Ironbreakers and Warriors find an eeire silence as they steadily work to fortify their positions before dawn, the quiet only broken by the occasion sharp, high-pitched screech echoing in the distance. Just above their location a couple of regiments of Quarrelers have been stationed to provide much-needed ranged cover for any scrum that may occur.

On the right flank you find a steep, open slope that would provide any hopeful assailant easy access into the heart of your position.  Here you decide to make your rat trap. At the base of your position you place your unfortunate bait, a skirmish line of stout and steady Miners. Behind them you place your spring, heavily armed Hammerers who are always eager to join then finish a fight. On a bluff overlooking them all you place your deadly and explosive Thunderers. You are optimistic that your firepower advantage can shock and break your enemy before their vast numeric superiority overwhelms you.

Your reserves are located In the rear on a grassy plain on the very top of the hill.  A detachment of unruly, death-seeking Slayers await to be rushed into combat to plug any holes that enemy monsters may make. Three batteries of organ guns prepare to paint the palette of enemy forces with iron spray from their barrels. Your lone Gyrocopter attachment is ready to lumber off to any location that is requested.

As the darkness finally lifts you find yourself peering into the distance, searching for any sign of the enemy. You don't have to look for long. The adjacent hillsides are awash with ugly, putrid rat men, quite visible despite the gray of the morning. You make a quick estimate and figure that the vermin horde must easily number into the tens of thousands. According to the last count from your quartermaster, you have 1753 dwarf ready for duty. The day should be very interesting.... | Game is good and feels like every other Total War. This review isn't negative because the game itself, its a fun game but Creative Assembly is nothing but a bunch of crooks at this point. Locking units from a base game faction behind a paywall is ridiculous.

DLC's are meant to be addons for flavor and revitalize playthroughs. CA continues to use them as a way to hold the base game hostage and force its players to spend mass amounts of money just to get the bare minimum.   Honestly fuck CA at this point. | NOTA: 8/10

 | r

First thing, this game is very very addictive, I'd give you that. Once you start a game you will find it very very hard to stop playing. My 227 hours play time should be evidence enough to prove my point. But sadly, among my 227 play time, 99% of it was solo play. I would dearly like to join a clan and play with some other players. But alas, although the game does support clan play, some feature of the game or should I say lack of it, made it very unfriendly for clan play.  

The one thing I hate about this game is that all members within a clan shares everything. And in everything, I mean freaking EVERYTHING. All you can do is to trust in your clan member's ethics and hope they won't rob you blind when you're not in the game. Even the stuff in your so-call personal strongbox can be access by your clan members. So what good is a personal strongbox if everyone can get the stuff you stashed in it. I mean, why put in a personal strongbox in the first place is its utterly useless. At least put in some permission settings for the owner to restrict access to their stuff. 

Another thing is the loot system. I once cleared a tier 2 rift boss when another player came in and took all my loot dropped from the boss. The player was not even a clan member, just another solo player who came in and ninja looted all my stuff. 

All of this BS is making it very hard for anyone to form and invite people into a clan unless all the clan members are also real life friends. No one likes to be betrayed and rob of their hard earn possessions when they are not looking.

But, after mentioning all the bad stuff, I'm still gonna recommend this to others. The solo play is still worth playing. | 76小时全成就，已经被多人残酷模式狠狠地恶心到了。游戏虽然有诸多可圈可点的设计，但瑜不掩瑕，其槽点之多让人忍不住想要打个差评好好说道说道。

1.异常不合理的数值，多动症到离谱的boss以及仿佛断了腿一般的主角性能。玩家作为一个高贵的吸血鬼，也是人见狗嫌走到哪被打到哪，机动性比隔壁魂游的不死人都要差的多的多。平时顶着残疾人的移速跑图就已经无比折磨了，打boss时更是只能依靠cd10秒以上的闪现来躲避攻击，背板躲招式几乎是刚需。而对比鲜明的是boss各种位移闪现aoe，快到根本看不清抬手的大范围攻击以及一刀砍一半血的离谱伤害技能比比皆是：制作组对boss的理解显然还停留在力大砖飞上，所谓的残酷模式就是闭着眼睛填数值，甚至多人打boss的体验远不如单人来的舒适，不仅boss的血量会超级加倍，满场不间断召唤的小怪和额外招式也是恶心至极。

2.后期极度枯燥乏味的物资刷取，以及重复度高达100%的科技树系统。整个游戏前中期还算有些新鲜感，但默认设置的合成材料倍率以及制造时间简直让人不知所谓：造一块铁就需要好几分钟，而建筑和武器又需要消耗大量各种不同的物资，导致时间都花在了反复刷取材料等待合成上面。每进入下一个科技阶段，材料其实只是换了个名字以及更加麻烦的获取方式，甚至还得手动去翻箱倒柜的刷取一些进阶材料，才能获得批量制造的许可。如此无聊的重复作业，以及套娃一般合成配方一直持续到了通关为止。此外，游戏后期还有许多明显只是为了拉长游戏时间的恶心设计，例如武器碎片、宝珠随机词条的刷取，还有限时的大地图关卡，每次只能刷取少的可怜的暗影碎片，用量却又多的吓人。

3.为了所谓的pvp平衡性而牺牲的pve体验。这一点是最让人无法理解，游戏内看似有多个法术体系和流派，还有多种武器装备，按理说应该能够支持自由度非常高的bd系统，但制作组侧重pvp的莫名自信让几乎绝大部分的法术都变成了换皮的垃圾，boss无脑免疫控制更是让部分法术显得有些小丑。相似的模板换个颜色改一改词条，就又是一个新法术了；只能装备两个法术的底层逻辑让构筑毫无自由可言，更加不存在什么所谓的法术之间的combo，数值给的也是无比保守，简直是生怕玩家打怪打爽了。

4.不合理的奖励解锁顺序。这游戏的法术是按照等级123的顺序来解锁的，打赢特定的boss可以给一个指定等级的技能点，而每个等级的法术又有好几个——制作组看似贴心地让你有选择优先解锁的权利，但实际上后解锁的技能本就是被玩家淘汰下来的，装备栏又只有两个，导致后解锁的技能点处在一个食之无味，弃之可惜的尴尬境地，塞进boss奖励里多少有些敷衍。此外，游戏的装备分为了不同流派，而高级的衣服也是需要打boss解锁的。策划的大智慧就体现在，他们非常贴心地给你安排了一个线性的解锁顺序，保证你在当前阶段只能先穿着没有任何词条的白板衣服去打boss，然后依次解锁制造台、制造材料1、制造材料2...直到你打完了前面所有的boss，都快要通关这个章节了，你才能做出一套完整的衣服。而这套衣服还没有焐热，当你们打完章节头目后，恭喜你——新的上位白板衣服又出现了，快拿着它去挑战下一章的新boss吧。

...其实还有不少零零散散的槽点，一时半会也想不起来/懒得写了，那就先这样吧。这个游戏明明有不少的优点，但在诸多槽点的结合之下，我的游玩体验并不是很好。考虑到它并不是一个半成品，而是已经开发了多年的游戏，部分问题的出现更是让人难以理解...好消息是目前制作组貌似还在继续更新游戏，这一点确实值得肯定。只能说，希望它早日成为一个更加优秀的游戏吧。 | Bir oyunun grindi bile hiç sıkmaz mı? Bu oyunun sıkmıyor. Atmosferi, combat mekanikleri, base tasarlaması vs. her şeyiyle 10/10. Bayılıyorum sana V Rising. | V Rising é um jogo incrível e muito divertido. Ele oferece uma experiência completa, com a possibilidade de construir castelos lindos e personalizados. É extremamente satisfatório, especialmente quando você derrota um boss depois de várias tentativas. A sensação de conquista é única e torna cada vitória ainda mais gratificante | 이 게임을 비추하는 사람들의 글을 읽어본 결과 공통적으로 게임 내에서 다 제공되는 기능으로 해결이 가능한 부분입니다. 입맛에 맞게 조율할 수 있도록 설계가 되어있는데 자기들이 매운맛 시켜놓고 맵다고 찡찡대는데 순한 맛으로 드시면 됩니다. 기본 맛은 매울 수 있는건 인정합니다. 저는 추천이지만 비추 글만 읽는 사람이 오해할까봐 비추에 적습니다.

Почему Dune: Spice Wars заработала Shiro Games существенно меньше денег, чем Northgard или хотя бы Wartales?

Думаю, дело в следующем:

1. Сложнее въехать (чем в другие работы Shiro). Надо провести хотя бы часов 5-6. И сходу непонятны не только мелкие нюансы, а целые механики.

2. Это не римейк той самой Dune 2. Нет танков, ракетниц, выдуманных Ордосов и много чего ещё. Так уж получилось, что совершенно неканоническая разработка Westwood для многих игроков является первоисточником.

3. Это не особо похоже на Northgard. Вернее, совсем непохоже.

4. Это не RTS, а стратегия 4X. Может быть не такая навороченная как некоторые представители жанра. Но тут точно не работает никакой раш и типовые для RTS подходы.

А теперь то же самое, но с точки зрения плюсов:

1. Что такое 5-6 часов для 4X? Я в своё время в Civ5 въезжал дольше, а в Stellaris окончательно понял как играть через 30 часов. 5-6 часов - просто идеальное время для понимания стратегии такого типа.

2. Shiro гораздо бережнее поработали с книгами. И эта работа с ограничениями заставила их выверять подходы и особенности до мелочей.

3. Если честно, я Spice Wars полгода боялся запускать. Так как думал, что это рескин Northgard с некоторыми наворотами. Ура, это не он!

4. Кому-то вообще нужна была бы Dune 3000? Серьёзно? Жанр устарел ещё в начале 00-х.

А ещё! Здесь редко бывает больше 10-12 юнитов под контролем - и это заставляет включать голову. Общая медлительность позволяет воевать на 2, а иногда даже на 3 фронта. Есть активная пауза (для соло-игры). Дерево развития выверено до мелочей. Стороны сильно отличаются по фишкам. Графика, стиль и вообще UI в целом - идеал.

Короче, отличная игра. Одна из лучших стратегий, в которые я играл за последнее время. | Interesting to begin with.  The game plateaus very quickly though. Very little replayable value for me.  After a couple of hours it gets tedious.  Boring.  I regret buying this game. | The novel Dune was written during the Cold War, and this game has that aura.

Do not expect a standard RTS. This is a game about statecraft, about cold wars, about the balance of power, about paranoia. Warfare is a continuation of policy by other means- often an inevitable one, but more pursued to deny the enemy victory than to seize it. It's more about medieval-style raids & chevauchées than massive campaigns. The Landsraad and intelligence systems are brilliant. Expect assassinations to be a more common threat than sieges of enemy capitals are.

As an adaptation of the novel within the confines of a Civ-style game, it's excellent. The great dangers of Arrakis, the thirst & the worms, are of both strategic & tactical importance- by which I mean they will destroy your entire army if you slip up. So many of the little details of the world are here as well, down to the Fremen donkeys. The factions from the book are invoked wonderfully in gameplay too- the honor and "honor" of the Atreides, the drugged-up thuggery of the Harkonnen troops, the vicious, vampiric fanaticism of the Fremen, the Corrinos lurking aside, playing one House against another until they can throw down a fortress from orbit and seize the planet for themselves. The additional factions are flavorful too.

I'd recommend this game in particular to those who love the book & its cynical philosophy, and to those who like the idea of games like Civ but want something leaner, quicker, & smarter. 

Note that God created the single-player mode to train for the multiplayer mode. This review has assumed that it's the latter you'll be getting the game for. | Feels great. The environment is very dangerous but fair. Politics works, which is impressive for this kind of game. The factions have good differentiation- Harkonnens oppress their people and throw away their own people to feed the machine. Fremen move easily in the desert but they don't get to vote in politics. Atreides can be very effective politcally and can take villages peacefully. And whoever you are, there are the constant pressures of collecting the Spice. | It's too much like the game Civilization and not enough like DUNE 2000.  

It's not a bad game and i can even see how it could have become oddly addicting for many people but for me personally it doesn't really have what i want to satisfy me.  The biggest issue is the lack of strategy involved for how you set up your base/territories.  In fact there is very little actual decision making that goes into your base setup at all.  Instead it's a repetitive process of taking over preexisting villages, then haphazardly placing whatever structures you need around it for that given territory depending on which resources the territory has.  It makes zero strategic difference where you place your buildings because they're never attacked anyway.   It's only the Villages themselves that ever come under threat.. which by the way you defend by repetitively hiring militia for every annex'd village.  In this regard, the game is totally brainless and requires no strategic thinking for how you go about setting up your territories.  In DUNE 2000, for example, there was a very satisfying sense of accomplishment for the way you choose to build your base and design it's defenses.  Spice Wars just doesn't have that.

There is a lot more i could say both negatively and positively about the game but it's mostly the lack of strategy and satisfaction that comes with conquering territories that bothers me.

This game plays like the bad part of chess in the sense that the "skill" in 1v1 is gated behind just memorizing the optimal opening troop deployment for the maps so you dont lose instantly. If you are a noob you dont have these memorized so you just lose all the 1v1s
But if you pass the opener you get to have fun

as far as controls, units, everything about this game is basically if you took BROKEN ARROW and simply made it shit. clunky controls, weirdly always oversaturated graphics that look awful. the AI is either a cake walk or curb stomps you.

for being a strategy game this game has the most dogshit community inside the actual game itself. just unnecessarily rude, toxic, very unwelcoming in general. ill be waiting for broken arrow. | 我的评价是不如断剑一根，一点都不好玩，甚至感觉还没自家红龙好玩，谁家步兵传奇耐打王，坦克炮直射半天打不死，直升机更是重量级，火炮也是纯纯的一坨，非常后悔自己居然原价购入了，实在是红龙给我的体验太好了，太相信欧根了，孩子们别买，除了音乐听着很爽，游戏体验简直是差的不行 | Best strategy game ever made in my honest opinion.  | Отличная стратегия от создателей Act of Aggression и Wargame!

Главные плюсы

Огромный выбор военной техники
Хорошая графика
Отличное музыкальное сопровождение (многие треки перекочевали в плейлист авто)
Широкие тактические возможности как на стратегической карте, так и в бою

Минусы

Игра ограничена определенным количеством ходов или выполнением стратегических целей. Бывает перехватишь инициативу на глобальной карте, начинаешь наступления на ослабленные дивизии врага и тут вылетает табличка - вы выполнили цели на глобальной карте и выдает список потерь как вражеских так и наших. В итоге нету того чувства победы и удовлетворения, как если бы была закрашена вся стратегическая карта и все дивизии врага уничтожены!

Юниты тупят при попытки заставить их двигаться по полям, половина может выбрать дороги, другая пересеченную местность, хотя двигаться по пересеченке перспективнее если не нужна скорость, ведь так можно избежать засад на дорогах.

Шкала усталости приводящая к дезорганизации, могли бы сделать ее прогрессивнее. 
К примеру национальные войска на своей земле имели больше лимита очков усталости до дезорганизации, а прибывшие союзные из других стран, обычные 8 очков, так как земля не их. Так можно ввести влияние успехов в компании, на очки усталости, если побеждаешь и стратегические потери врага в живой силе и технике больше твоих, то дивизии получают второе дыхание и воюют на превозмогание получая меньше усталости.

Game Name: Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin
Reviews:
As monster collecting JRPGs go, this is easily one of the best. There's a nice rock/paper/scissors system for attacks that's easy to learn, but changes up with each different monster, plus there's loose type advantages on top of that to add more complexity. Raising monsties is fun and simple, and if you're a Monster Hunter fan (which most people looking at this probably are) there's the extra fun of finding and fighting all your favorites. Plus, there's my favorite feature, which is the ability to automatically beat fights with monsters that are much weaker than you, which makes what little grinding you have to do and backtracking incredibly easy. | 除了剧情是一坨之外，游戏超好玩 | Surprisingly better than I expected, it does not deserve to be just at "very positive".

My one nitpick is that the story is kinda childish, but the gameplay and flashy techniques make up for it. | Fun game. Cool art style and designs. Cool attack animations. Good monster selection. | 一直黑屏一直黑屏，显卡驱动更新/重新下载/重启/检查完整性/拔掉外设我都试了，为什么还是黑屏，崩溃！
我22年的上一台电脑还能玩，最近想回坑，怎么都进不去。求助！！！

[h3]Ghoulishly delightful[/h3]

There isn't a whole lot of gameplay here, but it's still a lot of fun to work your way through each chapter and avoid the enemies. 

I didn't find the puzzles particularly difficult, they were just the right amount of challenge and fun.

The music, ambience, and art style are the real stars here. Even though the game itself was just about the perfect length, I still find myself wanting more. So, I'm excited to play the next instalment of this franchise | 8/10 gameplay has its bugs and little jank movement and grab mechanics, 10/10 story | [h2]阴湿爱好者狂喜的小游戏 [/h2]

[h3] 1.剧情 [/h3]
如果想看完整故事但只买了本体的话，建议玩一下dlc。DLC在剧情上相当于对1本体的补充，虽然整个游戏没有文字，但是结束游戏后不难理解故事内容以及时间顺序。
剧透吐槽
[spoiler]我：为什么变成妙脆角了被老6吃掉的人是我啊？
小也：你没看别人都很有脸色地逃跑了吗？就你在那逛大街。
我：行行行老子去死行了吧.jpg[/spoiler]

[h3]2.音画 [/h3]
偶尔为了看有没有遗漏收集我会调高视角看天花板，能看到已经吊死的人垂下来的双脚；在比较阴暗的场景打开手电筒还能看到友好npc被啃食的尸体，游戏的收集值得一做，不像有些游戏纯属恶心人复制粘贴场景，游戏内存在互动解锁隐藏通道完成收集的情况。
整个游戏色调特别暗，把亮度调最高也看不清一些角落，再加上手柄游玩手柄会模仿心脏跳动的频率一震一震非常有氛围感，不过胆小人士慎重考虑吧。
我个人很喜欢追求刺激感所以我还蛮享受的，恐游爱好者可以直接冲。

[h3] 3.操作 [/h3]
2比1流畅很多，我真的不喜欢跳跃后再加一个按键才能抓住墙壁的设定，而且不知道是1手感问题还是手柄被我搓坏了，dlc第一章水里游泳死活爬不上岸，甚至出现破防下线的情况…我打动作游戏都没有这样- -。
dlc道具有手电筒，跟2的旋转小壁灯比起来就像一个左右摇杆老在打架需要时刻来一巴掌才老实的雪花电视机。
游戏操作难度整体不高，就算手电筒恶心人我也一次过了关卡，整个游戏互动里应该只有跳跃后抓取这个动作存在修正判定，而且不能预输入（


[h3]*怎么被安利的和一些碎碎念 [/h3]
游戏DLC是多周目全成就知名梦魇爱好者乔阿也送我的，并赠言：[b]你也不想被别人知道你梦魇1因为没有DLC而没有全成就吧！[/b]
那时年轻，还不知道一切的礼物都暗中标好了价格……我开始玩游戏后小也才跟我说这个游戏有个[i]一命通关成就[/i]，呵呵，[b]毒妇[/b]
游玩体验上，1的有几个解谜比起2真有些难以理解，比如第二章绞肉机要进入一个小房间，打死我都想不到要往里面爬……小也为了监督我玩游戏，我也想利用她单周目达成全收集，就开启直播让她远程指导，贡献了很多下饭操作，后来知道有[i]一命通关成就[/i]后咽不下这口气，去她留言板恨恨留言——

[spoiler]阿也，突然好安静，我以为我们永远有话讲。是，我很好骗，我对打游戏没底线，能忍住一堆情绪还装没事的样子，但是没能一命通关梦魇1的每个瞬间我还是会不争气地掉眼泪，我知道我没本事，眼巴巴望着你希望你能施舍一些你的同情，不知道你在外面跟别的游戏过得怎么样？我知道我只是推荐了一个需要五周目全成就的游戏……可是五周目，不也练练就行了啊[/spoiler]

[b]然后收到了回复——[/b]

[spoiler] 亲爱的小香：
当你看到这段留言的时候，我已经在打二周目的路上了，请原谅我没有告诉你我的进度，我知道，如果我告诉你，肯定就打不下去了，因为就是你一边说着“阿也，我想到一款很适合你的阴湿游戏”一边鼓励我去玩，我才会就这样踏进深渊…
玩the cave的日子，是我这段时间最漫长的时光，我真的很想结束，继续玩下一款游戏，毕竟新的进度总要开始，小香，过去我不懂，恨是什么，是你让我明白，恨是当你恨上一个人会舍弃自己的良心换取她的痛苦，恨是当你恨上一个人会隐瞒游戏成就难度成全她的受难，恨是当你恨上一个人会愿意推她一把留下最坏的回忆和诅咒…
或许这就是我们彼此的相处方式吧，我说小香梦魇1阴湿得很、你一定要玩一下！好玩到做梦都会梦到它的！你说阿也the cave也很阴湿你玩了就知道！我可喜欢双胞胎的剧情了！
也许我们对彼此最后的默契就是互相隐瞒了这两个游戏都有一命通关的成就吧…
恨你的，小也[/spoiler]

Got into playing this game due to its offering- magic and guns. The hype died down at around 30% of the game when the "rinse and repeat" formula took effect. Played for 40+ hours and still wondering why I did that.
[list]
[*]Main Story is good. You get to experience a unique story in an open world filled with monsters and betrayals. The MC though, is another thing entirely. There were times when I wished that they should go jump off a nearby cliff (tried, does not work due to the game's strict "No Jumping" policy). Sometimes they are just dumber than a rock. I am gonna leave it at that.
[*]Game-play is enjoyable. You get to choose what you want to be- a dull magician with sick moves, a slow warrior with quick rolls or a crazed trickster (not actually but I call it that because you set traps in plain-sight and "trick" the monsters into stepping on it. Trust me bro, it works all the time). You get to use guns on all you build types. Even with all the skills, I always felt something was lacking. In-game currency(money) just exists because it has to.
[*]Visuals are a treat sometimes when the time and place is just right.
[*]Companions cannot be discarded. They stick by you and challenge insurmountable foes just to end up being a dead weight. They charge in with the same battle cries (Siora) that its now giving me nightmares at times. They can be revived, but then the most important question comes to mind... "Why?"
[*]Character models can be better but its not AAA game to go expecting much.
[*]Traversal is a pain. You have to run a lot from one fast travel point to another.
[*]Sounds are surprisingly good. It helps keep the immersion true and has a calming effect.
[/list]
I played two of the possible outcomes. Both outcomes were duller than expected. Got everyone on board for the finale and then betrayed them like a snake. Sounds intriguing at first but then got disappointed by the little effect it had.
Bugs encountered during the playthrough-
[list]
[*]Fell through the world when trying to activate "complex" magic that involves jumping(?huh). Not frequently but depends on the terrain.
[*]The DLC does NOT work (does not trigger after reading the note). Apparently something to do with mods. But people playing without mods have the same issue.
[*]Someone keeps adding stuff into the boxes stored all over the city. Even though it gets repeatedly plundered(by me). Either they are dumb or crazy. Maybe both.
[/list]

Хочу мультиплеер! | As much as I'd love this game to be developed into something bigger and more interesting, it's never going to happen. It's another case of abandonware, unfortunately. The game dev studio went bankrupt and the studio owning this title only sells DLCs but doesn't put out any updates.

For those who still thinks "it looks fine and there are some positive reviews so it cant't be that bad" I'll explain. Graphics, aesthetics and music in this game are amazing. Dialogue is cheesy but deliberately so. That will make you enjoy the first couple hours (at best).

BUT

The problem of this game is that devs didn't have any time to work on balance and game mechanics beyond "it doesn't crash". Once you establish your first production -> smuggling route, you've basically beaten the game. At that point you have an infinite money printing machine and other game mechanics don't do anything to provide any challenge whatsoever. Even on hard difficulty.

There's no world simulation, other clans won't expand or even build, the entire map is static. So it's only a matter of time to achieve control over different regions. There are random events which happen quite often but they only pose a challenge initially, while you are not familiar with different game mechanics. Once you understand how those mechanics work, events become completely toothless. Some of them don't harm you at all (there are even some positive early on) but in most events you can choose the worst option and it still won't cause significant harm to your economy.

On top of that there are some bugs which multiply the more you play, most are just annoyances but they don't go away and keep piling up. Some mechanics were not given much afterthought and not just allow you to cheese, you will do it unless willingly restrain yourself from doing so. To be fair, none of that is gamebreaking so it could have been fixed with patches. And that sours the taste even more, especially for early access backers like myself.

R.I.P. Cartel Tycoon.
