Seriously underrated survival game, up there with Valheim, ARK etc in my opinion, and especially good with friend/s

I cannot comment on what the PVP or public servers are like, but if you enjoy a good PVE co-op survival/RPG/base building game, this is for you. 

I would recommend raising the default XP rates as the 'awareness level' progress can feel a bit grindy and slows your progress more than it needs to. | 有身为好游戏的潜力，但是抄太多不是什么好事，适当精简内容也很重要。

1.原料和成品之间的半成品种类过多。不是说不能有半成品，而是过多之后玩家设计流水线的时候就会很麻烦。最好把不常用的半成品全部简化掉。

2.制作台过多。装备就分了工匠台、防具台和武器台，其它制作台也是有十来个。真没啥必要，除了占空间之外没啥优点。

3.屋顶和房屋承重。没啥好说的，糟粕罢了，希望可以去掉。不仅卡npc位置还卡我家具摆放，因小失大。

4.NPC不够智能。你抄了帕鲁那个流水线设计就没有想过他那个也是个半成品？种个地，家里我搓的种子和肥料用完了，npc都不会自己造的，然后就是一直垃圾信息轰炸我，让我从流水线设计里面抽出来帮他搓种子和肥料。

5.动物系统还是太简陋。而且那么小的动物我还需要陷阱？跑的没我快，我直接徒手薅起来不好吗？

6.游戏稳定性和优化有些问题。草和树太多导致玩久了会卡顿和闪退。

7.人形怪霸体太多了。

[hr][/hr]

1.25更新：

发现一些bug：

1.当玩家的基地处于水面上时，npc和可互动家具（制作台也算）交互后有概率掉到水里。
2.人物奔跑时使用太阳石给面甲充能会使右手发生扭曲，像骨折一样折到脑袋后面去。
3.脱离检测区域时（毒气区、高低温区），有概率会检测失败，导致玩家一直受到伤害。
4.族人的寻路ai有问题，通过楼梯上下楼默认取最近路线，会导致上楼的npc和下楼的npc撞在一起。而且摆多个楼梯npc也不怎么用。 | Мне очень нравится эта игра! Муж тоже нашёл в ней много интересного, играем в коопе. Мне нравится строить и менять скины и наряды. Мужу бегать и сражаться с боссами и страдать ерундой. Игра классная. Но интересно когда добавят больше причёсок и косметических настроек (надеюсь что скоро, ведь это ранняя версия), а так же изменений вида построек (например разные цвета для стен и крыш и т. д.) А так, мне очень нравится | After a thousand hours I can say the game itself is a brilliant little hidden gem of a game. Many elements to the game but the pvp is a little clunky; however being early access I'm hopeful this will see patches and fixes.

My issue lies with the developers itself; the games "rules" and restrictions for servers are not on the game itself it is all run via a discord server where the discord mods are... discord mods. Never have I known a game to have it's integrity held together by a discord server ran by moderators where all the rules for the game are found. Most of us have discord these days but even still; it feels... tacky. 

In addition to how the game is managed there is a problem with russian cheaters; you can provide all the evidence in a discord ticket and you will more than likely be ignored. And don't dream of bringing this issue up in the open chats as the discord mods will accuse you of nazism and ban you... simply for dropping a clip and highlighting the esping and bug abuse is increasing.

In add, brilliant game; poor management. | It's fun, and there should be more quality of life updates. There are too few interiors now.

I say yes because it is a good game but there are just some really dumb things. Here are 6 dumb things i found whilst playing the game.
1. There are way to many visitors in the park in early game. You open your park with ONE attraction and there's  900+ people spawning. That's way too much.
2. Despite having so much visitors, your rides barely have more than 20 people in queue. "Waiting queue is too long" bro its less than 3 mins. its just full of visitors walking up and down in my valley and colliding with each other.
3. Pathfinding is HORRENDOUS. I created a large entrance path in my park, more than 20 metres large. There are half the people that take the EXACT same line.
4. Opening a ride grabs all of your visitors, its just dumb. Its like a super powerful magnet.
5. Prices are stupid. They're ready to pay 35$ for some rides but not 0.5$ for karting? If its not free they wont go on the ride instead they will just do a u-turn and walk away from it.
6. The way technicians work is totally useless. It seems Fronteir spent some time developing plannings, but its useless? If i assign a technician to a ride, then why is he not repairing it during their shift and why do i have to call someone else? And why is he at the opposite side of my park + Its beyond stupid to have to wait until its too late for a technician to fix it. If i assign a technician to a ride, he should be around it for all their shift and checking it multiple during their shift. But no, they wait util its broken. Clowns.
It is a good game after all and i do enjoy playing it but i feel like they didn't test the game before publishing it. What i think they need to do is a huge update just fixing all the bugs and dumb things that there are.
Good game though. | A half-assed sequel to a pretty good game. The idea of planet coaster 2 was great and had me pumped for it, but it was a huge disappointment. A lot of rides from planet coaster 1 aren't in this, and the DLC is a huge cash grab. New workshop system is pretty bad. Steam workshop was heaps better. | 재밌습니다. 
겨울세일 20% 할인 때 구매해

There used to be a time when a game would be released in it's 1.0 foundational state, and it was fundamentally considered [i]complete[/i]. It meant that all the gameplay and story elements were in place, and any ancillary content could be added in at a future date. 
This could include extra story elements, items, dungeons, expansions, patches, and DLC etc.

Apparently, not anymore.

I waited for years to see Last Epoch exit early access and finally hit that glorious 1.0 release.
I even waited another year for the game to have all the creases ironed out.

So, I purchased the game, and was having a decent time. 
...that is, until the main quest storyline just 'stopped'.
Now to be clear, I don't mean it [i]concluded[/i]. I mean, it just 'stops' half-way through the story, and then you're left to go do mindless end-game farming. 
I genuinely thought my game was bugged and that the main quest wasn't showing. But a bit of research had me find out that the devs didn't think to complete the most basic element of a game - the story, before a 1.0 launch.

And what's worse, is that people just defend this type of practise?

Imagine if I sold you a book, but left the back half completely blank, and I told you "I'll write the rest some time in the future. Not really sure when though"
Not a sequel, but I'll finish the first book at some indeterminate time in the future.
Nebulous much?

Or imagine you sit down at a restaurant, and the waiter brings you only half of your meal, and says "We only made the first half - even though you paid for all of it. We'll eventually cook you the second half, at some point. Just not today. But you can have dessert! We have loads of dessert!"
Ludicrous. And yet, that's the standard that is being accepted more and more nowadays.

Sure, Last Epoch has some great elements to it. Genuinely.
Character building is cool. Loot filters in the game are top-notch. Visuals can be great.
But presentation means little when the foundational product is incomplete - [b]at full price[/b].

Ridiculous. 
Truthfully, I feel cheated. And looking at the 2025 road-map, where story content will be added 'some time later', I realise I should've just waited until the far off future when the game price will have likely dropped. 
Cheaper price for an 'actual' finished product.

This just feels like a lazy rush-to-market strategy, and I'd refund if I could, however it took me way more than the allotted refund time to know that the story would just 'cut off'. Which seems scummy.

Also, apparently even one of the game devs thinks you're being too unreasonable in expecting a 1.0 full release of a game to be, y'know, [i]'fully completed'[/i]. As he said that the 1.0 distinction of the game is "Fairly Arbitrary".
I call major bs on that one. 
You don't get to redefine what "Full Release" means, just to account for your lack of complete content. 

Furthermore, the endgame content, while nice in theory, honestly just boils down to this:

- Click a big floaty island in space.
- Now click on a smaller floaty island in space and fight a bunch of enemies.
- Do 10-20 more of these smaller floaty islands - with the same grinding of enemies.
- Now you've unlocked a boss fight.
- Fight said boss
- Click another big floaty island in space and repeat.

It's boring, and in no way a good placeholder for a completed and memorable story.

If the game was completed, I would've looked back on the game and thought "Yeah wow. That was a nice experience. Not [i]the best I've ever played[/i], but nice. And that's worth a recommend."

As it stands, I think you should stay away from the game for another year (or possibly two) - as of this review date, and reassess the state of the game at that time.

Until then, don't perpetuate crappy business standards - or they'll become normalised and you'll be the only one paying for it. | 离线模式要联网玩，联机体验极差，未入手的建议先看看视频和评测观望。 | The game isn't fun. This is a combination of skills that feel unimpactful, low monster density, overall slow game pace, low difficulty, and an endgame that encourages you to just rush through to the objective as fast as you can rather than kill anything, among other reasons.

Most of the praise around this game will be about "potential" rather than what's actually there. If you've played or followed this game since the beta you should know that the developers have done absolutely nothing to demonstrate they can ever deliver on this potential. What's actually implemented is very bare-bones, often buggy, and not fun/interesting. Will the game be good eventually? Maybe, but unlikely. And should you spend money on a game that isn't good right now? Absolutely not.

I really want to like this game. It has the best building system I've ever encountered and the professions are varied with plenty of unlockable content. However, that's where the good stops.

They added timers to crafting. This isn't a deal breaker in itself. Plenty of survival games add timers. But these are mobile game timers. For example, you need 100 charcoal to make bronze. You get 25 charcoal every 20 minutes. So that's 80 minutes of waiting to get the charcoal. Then it takes 15 minutes to make the bronze ingots. So that's 95 minutes of work (1 hour and 25 minutes) just to get a basic material. It's insane. 

Resource placement also needs a look over. Basic materials like tin end up right next to high leveled enemies which are impossible for you to defeat. Devs say the goal is to cooperate with others but the player base just isn't there. I've also seen ore nodes spawn in mid air and lots of materials like to spawn hanging on the side of mountains. 

Inventory management is another issue. You need so many materials to do anything and most of them have stack sizes of 25 or 50. You might think this is enough but it takes 50 wood just to make one order or charcoal. My house is basically a giant mountain of chests to store things at this point. There is just a major disconnect between how much chests store and the materials they require for recipes or leveling professions (i won't even touch on the ridiculousness in that as many other reviews already do).

I do not recommend this game at this time. The most pressing thing is the punishing timers on crafting and the sheer impossibility of inventory management. If these two things get fixed, then I'd change to recommended even with the other issues. | There is nothing on the store page saying that when they release the full game you have to purchase it again and pay monthly. (you have to go to other website to find out) hell no, i want my money back! Lot of money to drop on a game and DLC for an early access and you don't even get to keep it. Another money grubbing company ruining games. | Ich hatte von den Pax Dei viel erwartet und wurde leider enttäuscht.

Positiv zu bewerten ist die Graphik.

Negativ aufgefallen ist die Unübersichtlichkeit bei der Freischaltung von neuen Rezepten es fehlt ein Technologiebaum wie z.B. in Once Human.

Neue Spieler haben Momentan keine Möglichkeit Grundstücke zu beanspruchen, alles ist bereits besetzt!!! 

Es sind alle Burgen und Häuser, voll ausgebaut die Welt ist überfrachtet. 
Ja ok es ist Early Access - aber sollte man nicht genau hier Spieler gewinnen?
Stunden gelaufen nicht ein Spieler auf der Karte? 
Die Welt ist trotzdem tot und ausgestorben bei ca. 1000 Spieler zur besten Zeit hmmm Traurig.

Spielerlebnis was für ein Spielerlebnis - wozu weitermachen, warum mind. 3h Material Farmen von dem man Unmengen braucht und wegschmeißen darf so viele Kisten kann man nicht Bauen (Nachjustierung dringend erforderlich) - es gibt nichts was dich noch packt oder anregt weiterzuspielen. 

Hier ist der Hauptkritikpunkt.

Von hochwertigen Rezepten die man angeblich nur auf hohem Level mit wenigen Zutaten herstellen kann, habe ich nichts gesehen. 

Als Gildensklave zu enden ist auch nicht so mein Ding. Also welche Gründe gibt es weiterzuspielen, da fallen mir leider keine ein.
 | Pax Dei ist ein tolles Spiel, das zwar noch einige Ecken und Kanten hat, aber dennoch viel Spaß macht. Es befindet sich derzeit im Early Access, weshalb Menschen, die nicht gerne unfertige Spiele spielen, vielleicht noch etwas warten sollten, bevor sie zugreifen. Allen anderen kann ich das Spiel jedoch nur empfehlen.

Das Bauen macht richtig viel Spaß. Man hat die Möglichkeit, sehr schöne und kreative Gebäude zu entwerfen, was für Bau-Fans ein echtes Highlight ist. Das Kampfsystem ist noch nicht ganz ausgereift, aber es funktioniert bereits gut und bietet eine solide Grundlage.

Ein wichtiger Punkt, den man betonen sollte, ist, dass Pax Dei ein Spiel für Gruppen ist. Das bedeutet jedoch nicht, dass Solo-Spieler keinen Spaß haben können. Es dauert lediglich etwas länger, wenn man alleine baut und Fortschritte erzielt.

Insgesamt bietet Pax Dei eine spannende und unterhaltsame Erfahrung mit viel Potenzial. Wer bereit ist, die frühen Entwicklungsphasen in Kauf zu nehmen, wird auf jeden Fall auf seine Kosten kommen. | my first 100 hours were cool but played them solo and i got pretty far, i wanted to get into the magical stuff but it was a grind, then the reset happened and i decided this time around i wanted the 4 plots and 6 character slots so i could do a more character focused approach but when i purchased the masters pack i didnt get what they promised me was part of the pack according to their website i was supposed to get a bunch of access but it treated me like i didnt buy anything so i uninstalled the game, requested a refund and quickly withdrew all the support i had for the game, i WILL NOT SUPPORT SCAM ARTISTS

Reviews:
This game is so well optimized you can zoom out to see thousands of platforms and then zoom all the way in to see the wood grain on an individual conveyor belt with no stuttering or loading. It's a beautiful work of engineering. | The game is fantastic. My favorite part is that there's no stress. You can build at your leisure without having to worry about currency or timelines or damage or enemies. It's just chill! | 玩过一代后买了二代，三天连续玩了三十多个小时，刚开始玩了几个小时以后发现音乐非常不错，于是又入了支持者版本。这个游戏我感觉是非常解压的，我老婆我回家开始玩，一晚上了没理她，一直在自言自语，其实我就是在不断优化产线，删了改改了删，不经意间就能消磨几个小时的时间。最后自己画了几套蓝图，各种满速的旋转、堆叠、上色等模块，开开心心的打完了操作员通行证。就在进一步想研究一下电信号的时候，我上B站看到了大神做自动化工厂模块。天哪，人家这模块做的，简直就是外挂一样，操作员只需要输入图形，各个平台就能自动解析，自动 送货、拼接、染色、交付。看完以后简直就是天塌了，有了电信号以后，相比之下我自己玩的这些简直是小儿科，在全自动模块下，操作员似乎只需要输入图形然后挂机，这完全失去了游戏的乐趣。并且人家这套系统看起来是天衣无缝。如果游戏到了后期都是这样的话，那我宁可不玩了。当然，设计这套全自动生产交付的系统是需要超高的水平和时间的，但是这是在游戏啊，难道这个游戏的终极目标就是设计一套”内挂“让操作员挂机么，对此我表示很不理解，但是毕竟在没有看到这套系统前，我还是很喜欢这个游戏和音乐的，所以还是要给好评，只能说电信号系统解锁前的游戏内容，很好玩。 | its very good at keeping me playing because to me its not overwhelming as the other games with similar gameplay out there. | Played a little of the first and never really got it but enjoyed the concept so took a shot on the sequel.

Much better beginner experience in this one.. the super simple license test or whatever being a great intro to the concepts which then left me eager to start on hard to really scratch the brain itch.

The game is that perfect brain teaser in a visually pleasing package.. you look at a new shape and freak out at all the steps involved, then you design a factory that ends up being way more compact and efficient than you ever thought *feels good* and once that's delivered, you get introduced to the next layer of complexity. 

Still very early on in the game, but looking forwards to just how crazy it sends me in the best way.

Really wish I could recommend it but I can't. | As fun as the gameplay is, that's like literally the only compliment i can give it outside of the game looking beautiful, it's a sadistic grindfest that is so unbelievably overwhelming for any player, i have 200 hours and i still have zero clue what im doing because i am being constantly bombarded with new items and systems that by the time i get a grasp on one thing, i have to learn 5 more new things. | I didn't really doing anything in the first 6 hours and ended up with a full inventory of stuff... just stuff. The combat early on seems pointless as you can be surrounded by 20 mobs and take no damage. The graphics in the game are quirky with a ton of lighting issues making the game look awful most of the time. The user interface is horrid with overlays overlaying other overlays upon more overlays... it's a mess visually. Why would I want to get notified of other players failing crafting when I am just starting the game? It's a UX/UI designers nightmare. Early story and quests are meh. If I were to summarize my new experience, I wouldn't say it was "bad", I would say it's "a turn off". | Black Desert Online has one of the best early and mid-game experiences. Progress feels rewarding, the world is vast and fun to explore, and there's a real sense of discovery. However, the late game is a completely different story.

Once you hit the late-game grind, progression slows down dramatically, taking anywhere from 20 to 100 hours just to see any improvement. Season characters are a great addition, but they also remove the early game entirely by handing out free PEN gear, which can feel like skipping one of the best parts of the game.

The biggest issue is how demanding the late game is, both in time and money. The game leans heavily into pay-to-win mechanics—you can buy Crons, making enhancement much less painful for those willing to spend money. While Black Desert has an incredible combat system and PvP is amazing, there's just not enough meaningful PvP content in the open world.

Overall, Black Desert isn’t a terrible game, but the late-game grind and monetization model make it hard to recommend unless you're ready to sink an absurd amount of time (or money) into it.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Early Access
Reviews:
Mit 50 Jahren noch ein Spiel zu entdecken, das einen fesselt, motiviert, zum Überlegen anregt und einfach begeistert , ist wirklich schön - DANKE DAFÜR! | Please fix the crash that results in a total hardware reset. The game is great, but currently unplayable for those that don't wish to damage their computers. | This is a really good game. I'm a newcomer to PoE, having only briefly tried the first game a few years back. I consider myself a fairly casual ARPG player, but I love RPGs in general. This game is very much worth the cost of admission.

This game's combat feels satisfying in a way that no other modern ARPG has quite managed for me. The character progression and build variety have been the real highlights, though. The various systems for managing skills, stats and gear are really enjoyable and easily understandable. The best part is you'll actually have to use these systems since the game isn't afraid to provide a challenge.

The amount of mechanical depth on offer here is really impressive for how intuitive everything is at a glance, you can tell the devs really put a great amount of thought and care into how everything is presented. There are some rough edges, but overall the game is really good in this regard.

I strongly dislike using guides, so I've gone in as blind as possible. I highly recommend taking this approach, despite what some players might say. Using a guide is not necessary, and overpowered builds will likely get nerfed. If you use a guide you are doing yourself a genuine disservice and ignoring the most interesting aspects of the game. That's just my two cents though, play the game however you like.

I don't have many complaints. I think endgame would be more fun if the player could return to an area after dying. The XP loss is a good mechanic in my opinion, but I don't like having to restart from scratch AND use another waystone in order to do so. It's tedious and requires too much attention. The game currently doesn't attempt to accommodate more casual players at endgame. I think more options and a less restrictive structure would help a lot. As it stands now, the campaign is the most enjoyable part of the game.

Vá na sua conta de POE 1, pegue o endereço de email da desenvolvedora, mande um email pedindo para consertarem o bug do seu boneco que por acaso VOCÊ PAGOU para jogar dessa vez, receba um email deles dizendo "lamentamos mas não atendemos mais por email devido a alta demanda" (mas atendem se for por conta de compras né?????), veja eles te passarem os mesmos links que eles não resolveram os problemas de foruns, veja que não tem nenhuma solução, grite bem alto: "VOCÊS CONSEGUEM FAZER UM JOGO BOM E TEREM UM PÓS ATENDIMENTO PÉSSIMO 3G".
